  • havoc.autoval.tests.storage.flash.nvme_format.nvme_format

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.storage.flash.nvme_format.nvme_format

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.drive import DriveType
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.storage_test_base import StorageTestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.filesystem_utils import FilesystemUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.nvme_utils import NVMeUtils



[docs]class NvmeFormat(StorageTestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(NvmeFormat, self).__init__()
        self.fstype = self.test_control.get("fstype", "ext4")
        self.secure_erase_option = 0
        self.drive_interface = "nvme"
        self.format_base_nvme = True
        self.format_ns = True
        self.cycle = self.test_control.get("cycle_count", 1)
        self.mnt = "/mnt/havoc"



[docs]    def setup(self, *args, **kwargs):
        super(NvmeFormat, self).setup(*args, **kwargs)
        # get all ssd drives and store in self.test_drives
        self.test_drives = self.get_test_drives_from_drives(
            drive_type=DriveType.SSD.value, interface=self.drive_interface
        )
        self.nvme_utils = NVMeUtils(self.host)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        nvme_drives = self._get_nvme_with_namespace(self.test_drives)
        self.validate_condition(self.test_drives, "Check for usable ssd drives")

        for _cycle in range(0, self.cycle):
            for device, namespaces in nvme_drives.items():
                # formatting the namespaces
                if self.format_ns:
                    for ns in namespaces:
                        self._format_nvme(ns, self.fstype, self.secure_erase_option)
                # formatting nvme drive
                if self.format_base_nvme:
                    self._format_nvme(
                        device, self.fstype, self.secure_erase_option, verify=False
                    )


    def _get_nvme_with_namespace(self, test_drives):
        nvme_drives = {}
        for drive_obj in test_drives:
            nvme_drive = self.nvme_utils.get_nvme_ns_map(
                drive_obj.block_name, drive_obj.serial_number
            )
            nvme_drives.update(nvme_drive)
        return nvme_drives

    def _format_nvme(self, device, fstype, secure_erase_option, verify=True):
        if verify:
            is_formatted = False
            self._mount_drive(device, fstype)

        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.nvme_utils.format_nvme,
            [device, secure_erase_option],
            "NVME Formatting on device %s" % (device),
        )
        # Mount must fail, as the FS has been erased by nvme format.
        if verify:
            try:
                mnt = self.mnt + "_" + device
                FilesystemUtils.mount(self.host, device, mnt, force_mount=False)
            except Exception:
                is_formatted = True
            self.validate_condition(
                is_formatted, "Formatting verified on device %s" % (device)
            )

    def _mount_drive(self, device, fstype):
        # Make sure to unmount device if it is mounted.
        # Otherwise file system creation will fail.
        mnt = self.mnt + "_" + device
        mount = FilesystemUtils.is_mounted(self.host, mnt)
        if mount:
            FilesystemUtils.unmount(self.host, mnt)
        FilesystemUtils.create_filesystem(self.host, device, fstype, "")
        FilesystemUtils.mount(self.host, device, mnt)
        df = FilesystemUtils.get_df_info(self.host, device)
        self.validate_condition(
            df["type"] == fstype, "Mounted %s at %s" % (device, mnt)
        )
        FilesystemUtils.unmount(self.host, mnt)




[docs]def main():
    test = NvmeFormat()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
